task_summary: A robotic arm is tasked to pour liquid from a held container into a mug on a table surface, with adequate perception and approach to ensure precision.

task_long_description.overview: This episode demonstrates a robot arm equipped with a gripper and a container performing a precise pour into a mug placed centrally on a wooden table. The scene requires the robot to perceive the mug, approach and align above it, execute a controlled pour by tilting the container, and then safely retreat. Objects involved include the robot, container, mug, and table. No spilling, mug displacement, or incomplete pour is tolerated.
preconditions: Robot holding container with pourable content
Mug placed stably on table within workspace
No obstacles between robot and mug
stepwise_plan: Check if mug is visible; scan if not detected
Move above the mug with sufficient clearance
Pour from container into mug with controlled tilt and rate
Retreat to a safe distance after pouring is complete
success_criteria: Container successfully poured into the mug
Mug remains upright and in place
failure_and_recovery: Failure: mug not detected → retry scan three times
Failure: pour blocked or incomplete → optional task abort
Recovery: initiate retreat or safe abort sequence
task_long_description.termination: Task ends after a successful pour and safe retreat; or abort if repeated detection fails.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks whether the mug is currently visible to perception.
Attempts to scan for the mug using a linear pattern up to three times.
Detects the mug and localizes its position.
Moves the container above the mug with a vertical offset.
Pours the entire contents from the held container into the mug.
Retreats the robot arm to a safe distance after pouring.

recovery_strategy: Scan up to three times for mug
assumptions: Frames show robot already grasping container (pour source)
Instruction does not specify amount—frames confirm 'full' pour occurs
Container identity inferred from frames; not explicitly named in instruction

expected_success_criteria: Liquid flows into mug with no spillage
Robot arm finishes above mug and then retreats
